verses.text: To the chief Musician on Neginoth, Maschil, \add A Psalm\add* of David, when the Ziphims came and said to Saul, Doth not David hide himself with us? Save me, O God, by thy name, and judge me by thy strength.
Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.
For strangers have risen up against me, and oppressors seek after my soul: they have not set God before them. Selah.
Behold, God \add is\add* my helper: the LORD \add is\add* with them that uphold my soul.
He will reward evil to my enemies; cut them off in thy truth.
I will freely sacrifice to thee: I will praise thy name, O LORD; for \add it is\add* good.
For he hath delivered me out of all trouble: and my eye hath seen \add its desire\add* upon my enemies.
